Because some old router implementations, especially, if you want to get technical,

just based on the fact that they have flags set in the TCP header.

And so it's interesting to these people, these what should we call them, pointy hairs,

If the packet comes from Swift trying to tell that to his machine, I want to route that to the lowest possible priority.

lower your latency if you are at a lower priority and your type of service flags are set

Back in about, in the 1900s, in small towns,
there were about, say, a town of 30,000, you would usually find

All the people that own these newspapers, they were family owned, the media, there wasn't
this big corporate media state, so all the newspapers were family owned.
And what happened was, they managed to, because they weren't public and because they didn't
they didn't have to report what they made to the SEC, only to the IRS, which is obviously not available to all of us, maybe some of us.
But anyway, what happened was that they went quite a while and with the illusion that they weren't making any money.

of it.

the third, the third generation that gets passed down an inheritance from a large estate,
there's a great big inheritance tax that they get hit with.
And because they were, because these newspapers were privately owned,
the inheritance tax just killed these people, and they didn't want to pay it, obviously.

did instead was they incorporated before dad died. And so when you incorporate, you sheltered

corporations. And then in the 60s and the 70s, as things marched on, they started to merge.
